alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:44AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine, including the following county, Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Coos and Grafton. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Additional heavy rainfall could result in Flash Flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1143 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Berlin, Bethel, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Franconia, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Tamworth and Sandwich.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
